= Components =

|| *Component Code* || *Component Name* || *Function* || *Comments* ||
|| *BSA.CR* || Cerebellum || Motor coordination || ||
|| *BSA.RN* || Red Nucleus || Motor coordination || Crawling of babies is controlled by RN ||
|| *BSA.LTG* || Laterodorsal Tegmental Nucleus || Modulating sustained attention or in mediating alerting responses || ||
|| *BSA.LC* || Locus Coeruleus || Regulate the intensity of responses to salient stimuli || NE Source ||
|| *BSA.RP* || Raphe Nucleus || Regulate moods, temper anxiety, and relieve depression || Releases 3HT (serotonin) hormone (happiness) ||
|| *BSA.VTA* || Ventral Tegmental Area || Respond to novel stimuli, unexpected rewards, and reward predictive sensory cues || ||
|| *BSA.NA* || Nucleus Ambiguus || Control muscles of pharynx || on par with VGM ||
|| *BSA.RF.MES* || Mesencephalic Reticular Formation || Saccades, fixation, gaze holding and vergence || Spaceâ€“time coordinated rapid eye movements ||
|| *BSA.RF.PO* || Pontine Reticular Formation || Maintenance of alertness and the conscious state || ||
|| *BSA.RF.MED* || Medullary Reticular Formation || Somatic motor control || ||

= Citations =

{{{
- Serotonin is the neurotransmitter that triggers sleep
- Serotonin raises the threshold for pain, inhibits "arousal functions,"
  lowers blood pressure, stimulates secretion of mucus in the lungs,
  and is associated with emotional calming
- Serotonin hyperactivity results in improved appetite, weight increase, 
  an urge to sleep, dampened consciousness, slower thought processes, 
  loss of drive, decreased muscle tone, slowing of the circulation, introversion, and poor sleep
